intro: Jurgensenia, commonly known as the Jurgensenia plant, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and compound leaves with a distinctive, fern-like appearance. The flowers are small and typically arranged in umbels, a common feature among members of the carrot family. Jurgensenia species are native to various regions in South America, particularly in the Andes. Due to their ornamental value and unique foliage, they are occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
